intro: Siphisia sericea, commonly known as silverleaf siphisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Siphisia sericea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
